books.title: The Eye of the World
books.mcburneyReview: It reads kinda like a Fellowship of the Ring rip-off, but that was sort of forced to get the book published. It's okay, but the series took 2 books to hook me.

books.title: The GreatHunt
books.mcburneyReview: This is where I fell in love with the series wholeheartedly. Book 2 is *really* where the Wheel of Time hints at it's amazing scope and depth.

books.title: The Dragon Reborn
books.mcburneyReview: I was just upset to see so little of the main character. Has some extremely important lore reveals that become the bedrock of much of the series.

books.title: The Shadow Rising
books.mcburneyReview: Easily was my favorite book. The last 200 pages I read in one sitting because I couldn't put it down.

books.title: The Fires of Heaven
books.mcburneyReview: The second half of this book is 5/5 and among the best in the series. The first half has a plotline that drags the pace to a halt.

books.title: Lord Of Chaos
books.mcburneyReview: The series starts to spread out and slow down, as this very much enters the series's "middle-game" phase. The ending, however, is 5/5 again.

books.title: A Crown of Swords
books.mcburneyReview: For many, the start of "The Slog", but it's not that bad, with definite high points. The ending was a bit confusing.

books.title: The Path of Daggers
books.mcburneyReview: About a year after reading it, I struggle to remember much of anything happening in this book. It felt very slow when reading.

books.title: Winter's Heart
books.mcburneyReview: While other storylines are still "setting up" for later payoffs, the main character's storyline in this book is absolutely fantastic. I loved reading this book, and don't get why others consider it part of "The Slog"

books.title: The Crossroads of Twilight
books.mcburneyReview: The worst Wheel of Time book I've read is still a good book. Not "bad", it just serves as the last bit of setup before plots start paying off big time in Knife of Dream.

books.title: New Spring
books.mcburneyReview: A fun prequel adventure. Not necessary to read, but it's a good palate cleanser if the slow pacing of the last few books gets you down. Gives some great lore into Moraine and Lan.

books.title: Knife of Dreams
books.mcburneyReview: Robert Jordan's final book before his death pays off so many plotlines! Action-packed, we see how the massive cast has grown over the years. This is also the last book I have read so far, but hope to finish the series in 2025.

tv.season1: Disappointingly bad. Tons of unnecessary changes, most of them for the worse. Really missed on the tone of the series.
tv.season2: A significant improvement over season 1. There are still some changes I don't love, but closer to the source material. Gives me hope they can save it.
